<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Argument handling is mostly uniform between the four places that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// make these decisions: function formal arguments, call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// instruction args, call instruction returns and function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// returns. However, once a decision has been made on where an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// argument should go, exactly what happens can vary slightly. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// class abstracts the differences.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// ValueAssigner should not depend on any specific function state, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// only determine the types and locations for arguments.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/valueassigner"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/valueassigner/#a356248ea0464de7b7fa769e23aa0690c">ValueAssigner</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// marshalling.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="574"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p CI is the call/invoke instruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p ResRegs are the registers where the call&#39;s return value should be</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="579"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// each non-aggregate type, as returned by \\c computeValueLLTs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p ArgRegs is a list of lists of virtual registers containing each</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="582"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// argument that needs to be passed (argument \\c i should be placed in \\c</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// non-aggregate type, as returned by \\c computeValueLLTs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p GetCalleeReg is a callback to materialize a register for the callee if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the target determines it cannot jump to the destination based purely on \\p</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// CI. This might be because \\p CI is indirect, or because of the limited</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="593"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// range of an immediate jump.</span></CodeLine>
